page.title: 12Farming no.2
page.content: There are l3 farms in the area, covering 2,l72 acrea approximately. The soil is rich though quite a lot of artificial fertiliser is used to produce maximum results. Most farms grow some corn, 9 farms have sheep - one of these being a sheep farm only.Two farms produce milk, which is collected by bulk tankers and taken to a factory where it is processed for dried milk and chocolate. Cattle found in the area are mainly Hereford and Friesian cross-breds, and are sold mainly in the markets of Hereford, Worcester, Tenbury, and Ledbury. After shearing, the wool is sold, by compulsion, to the British Wool Marketing Board.
